person.persName: Abraham B. Gardner (Bennington, Vermont, attorney and politician )

body.p: Bennington, Vermont, attorney and politician. Vermont native. Son of David Gardner and Eunice Gardner. Married to Mary J. Gardner c.1850. Father of Anna Gardner and Isaac T. W. Gardner. Graduated from Union College in Schenectady, New York, in 1841. Admitted to the Vermont bar in Bennington County, Vermont, in February 1847. Attorney in Bennington in 1850. State attorney for Bennington County between 1855 and 1857. Vermont Banking Commissioner between 1855 and 1867. Attorney in Bennington in 1860. Employed Ann Tynan and Margaret Lonnegan in Bennington in 1860. Member of the Vermont House of Representatives from Bennington County from 1860 to 1865. Enrolled for military duty in First District of Vermont on May 1, 1863 (U.S.A). Vermont speaker of the house from 1863 to 1865. President of the senate of the state of Vermont in 1865. Appointed lieutenant governor of Vermont from 1865 to 1867.
